title: PC Clarke — ‘Concern for your welfare’ texts preceding unannounced visit

key_quotes: Hi ben, its PC Clarke from sussex police. Can you give me a call?
Yes, we havent met before i just want to have a chat and see how you are doing. Theres been a concern for your welfare.
When did this become apparent? — Today. Can i call you shortly?
One of my colleagues was supposed to contact you, did they not?
Like i explained previously, they were supposed to contact you regarding your welfare
I told the police members you'd sent out there was no point calling 999 as i had since april 6th and 101 constantly and your message was the first i'd had any contact with

notes: Text thread uses welfare language minutes before the unannounced visit. Acknowledges colleague was supposed to contact earlier; suggests pretext/damage control rather than case ownership.
